title: Top 10 Packing Tips for a Stress-Free Move
excerpt: Practical, time-saving packing tips to protect your belongings and reduce moving stress.
author: Swift Removals
content_html:
Packing well saves time and reduces the risk of damage. These 10 packing tips will help you prepare efficiently for moving day.

1. Start early and make a plan

Begin packing non-essential items several weeks in advance. Create a room-by-room plan so you don't rush at the last minute.

2. Use quality packing materials

Invest in sturdy boxes, bubble wrap, packing tape and markers. Reusing damaged boxes increases the chance of breakage.

3. Label boxes clearly

Label each box with the room name and a short contents list. Add handling notes like FRAGILE when necessary.

4. Pack heavier items at the bottom

Place heavier items on the bottom and lighter items on top. This prevents crushing and maintains balance.

5. Protect electronics and valuables

Take photos of electronics before disconnecting them, keep original cables together, and use bubble wrap for screens.

6. Create an essentials box

Pack a clearly marked box with essentials — toiletries, chargers, a change of clothes, important documents and snacks.

7. Use soft items as padding

Towels, blankets and clothing can double as padding around fragile items, saving boxes and space.

8. Disassemble where possible

Remove legs from tables and beds and keep screws in labelled bags taped to the furniture.

9. Keep valuables with you

Jewellery, passports, certificates and anything irreplaceable should travel with you, not in the moving truck.

10. Check labels on arrival

When the truck arrives, place boxes directly in their destination rooms to save time unpacking later.

Pro tip: ask your removals company about wrapping services for fragile furniture — it can save time and reduce damage risk.

title: How to Choose the Right Removals Company in South Africa
excerpt: Key questions and checks to make when hiring a removals company so your move is safe, insured and on-time.
author: Swift Removals
content_html:
Choosing the right removals company can make or break your moving experience. Use this checklist to evaluate providers.

Ask for a written quote

Get a detailed, written quote that breaks down labour, transport, packing and any extra services such as storage or insurance.

Check insurance and liability

Confirm the company’s liability policy for damaged or lost items. Ask about additional insurance options if you have high-value goods.

Read reviews and ask for references

Look for recent reviews on Google and social media. Ask the company for references, especially for similar moves and distances.

Confirm vehicle and crew details

Ask about the truck size, parking requirements, and the number of crew members who will attend on moving day.

Find out about permits and parking

For city moves, confirm who will arrange parking permits or load zone access if required.

Compare multiple quotes

Get at least three quotes and compare what’s included. The cheapest option isn't always the best — consider reputation and service.

Local tip: confirm the company's experience with apartment moves, stair carries and fragile or bulky items.

title: Moving Day Checklist — What to Do Before the Truck Arrives
excerpt: A practical checklist to follow on moving day so everything goes smoothly when the removal team arrives.
author: Swift Removals
content_html:
Moving day brings a lot to coordinate. Use this checklist in the hours before the truck arrives to keep everything on track.

Confirm arrival time

Call your removals provider to confirm the arrival window and expected crew size.

Prepare access and parking

Reserve parking or clear the driveway. Remove obstacles that could block the loading process.

Keep pets and children safe

Arrange for pets and small children to be with a friend or in a secure room away from the moving activity.

Have tools and paperwork ready

Keep screwdriver, pliers, and any disassembly tools handy. Keep your ID, booking confirmation and contact numbers accessible.

Walk through the home with the team

Point out fragile items, special instructions and difficult access points like narrow staircases or lifts.

Do a final check

Before the truck leaves, do a quick sweep of the property for forgotten items, and lock windows and doors.
